description: Initial prime in first sequence of n primes congruent to 5 modulo 6.
references: R. K. Guy, "Unsolved Problems in Number Theory", A4
links: Giovanni Resta, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..35 (terms < 4*10^14)
example: a(12) = 1820111 because this number is the first in a sequence of 12 consecutive primes all of the form 6n + 5.
mathematica: NextPrime[ n_Integer ] := Module[ {k = n + 1}, While[ ! PrimeQ[ k ], k++ ]; Return[ k ] ]; PrevPrime[ n_Integer ] := Module[ {k = n - 1}, While[ ! PrimeQ[ k ], k-- ]; Return[ k ] ]; p = 0; Do[ a = Table[ -1, {n} ]; k = Max[ 1, p ]; While[ Union[ a ] != {5}, k = NextPrime[ k ]; a = Take[ AppendTo[ a, Mod[ k, 6 ] ], -n ] ]; p = NestList[ PrevPrime, k, n ]; Print[ p[ [ -2 ] ] ]; p = p[ [ -1 ] ], {n, 1, 18} ]
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Oct 09 2000
extensions: More terms from Don Reble (djr(AT)nk.ca), Nov 16 2003
More terms from _Jens Kruse Andersen_, May 30 2006
